description: President Biden is using new executive actions to block migrants from seeking asylum at the southern border. The ACLUE says this goes against U.S. asylum laws.
title: ACLU sues Biden administration over new executive action on the southern border
House republicans vote to hold Attorney General Merrick Garland in contempt

description: There are fears of a second full-on war igniting on Israel's northern border. Hezbollah, the group based in Lebanon and backed by Iran, has been trading fire with Israeli forces across the Israel-Lebanon border since Israel's conflict with Hamas began last October. Those exchanges of fire have hit new peaks recently. We hear from two NPR correspondents who each visited a side of that border.
title: Increased Fighting on the Israel-Lebanon Border
Colorado Republicans call to oust party chairman after he attacked Pride Month

description: Several pro immigrant organizations -- the ACLU, National Immigrant Justice Center, and Texas Civil Rights Project—filed the first lawsuit challenging the Biden administration’s executive actions restricting asylum in the Southern border.
title: Immigrations groups challenge Biden's asylum restrictions in court

description: The Southern Baptists Convention has wrapped with votes on banning churches with women pastors and opposing IVF reproductive practices plus revisiting reforms proposed to handle sex abuse claims.
title: Southern Baptists don't change their stance banning women pastors

description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Patti Davis about Hunter Biden's trial, addiction, and the pressure of the public spotlight.
title: Patti Davis on Hunter Biden, addiction, and the pressure of the public spotlight

description: NBA legend Jerry West has died. His silhouette is the basis of the NBA logo and was an All-Star each of the 14 years he played for the Los Angeles Lakers. He left his mark as a team executive too.
title: NBA great Jerry West dies

description: Cross-border fire between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon has hit a new high during the 8-month Gaza war: many fear it could ignite a full-on war
title: A view from both sides of the Israel-Lebanon border

description: Voters may not have foreign policy at the top of their list of concerns, but it is a major part of a U.S. president's role.
title: U.S. presidents and foreign policy

description: Nevada's U.S. Senate race will be closely watched this year. One voting group critical in the outcome is nonpartisan voters, who make up more than 30 percent of the state's registered voters.
title: Nevada's nonpartisan voters could play a major role in deciding key U.S. senate race

description:
America is facing two very different futures on the world stage after November.

If former President Trump wins, he's promised to fundamentally re-evaluate the NATO alliance, reshape global trade and overhaul the Pentagon, State Department and intelligence agencies.

He's largely avoided explaining how he'd handle the conflicts in Europe and the Middle East, yet says he can settle the war in Ukraine in 24 hours.

Meanwhile, if President Biden wins, he's signaled his commitment to fight global threats to peace and freedom, and he's vowed to continue to help Ukraine and Israel fight in their respective wars.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: What a second Biden or Trump presidency could mean for American allies and foes

description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady while signaling it can cut rates only once this year. The decision came after data earlier showed inflation cooling slightly.
title: The Fed holds rates steady, sees only one rate cut in 2024 as inflation cools slowly

description: Around 1 in 6 U.S. adults practice yoga. The mind-body activity has grown and evolved over recent decades, into more accessible versions that reflect a current focus on mental health and mobility training, researchers say.
title: Have we reached peak yoga in the U.S.? The CDC wants to know

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks filmmaker Lauren Windsor about her secret recordings of John Roberts and Samuel Alito.
title: Filmmaker who recorded Alito, Roberts says she did it ‘in service of a public good’

description: Hunter Biden was found guilty of three felony charges stemming from his purchase of a handgun in 2018. The Philadelphia Orchestra renames its concert hall after hometown legend Marian Anderson.
title: Hunter Biden found guilty on federal gun charges; Philly’s tribute to Marian Anderson

description: The House is expected to vote Wednesday on a resolution to hold Attorney General Merrick Garland in contempt.
title: House Republicans prepare to hold Attorney General Garland in contempt

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks legal analyst Sarah Isgur for her reaction to the secret recordings of Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts and Justice Samuel Alito and his wife.
title: Analysis of what a hidden microphone may have revealed about the Supreme Court

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks filmmaker Lauren Windsor about her secret recordings of John Roberts and Samuel Alito.
title: A filmmaker secretly records Supreme Court Chief Justice Roberts and Justice Alito

description: G7 leaders are meeting in Italy, where Pope Francis will join them to talk about the ethics of artificial intelligence.
title: Why G7 leaders are turning to a special guest — Pope Francis — for advice on AI

description: A new genomic analysis hints at why African Americans face a higher risk of Alzheimer’s and stroke, but a lower risk of Parkinson’s.
title: African ancestry genes may be linked to Black Americans' risk for some brain disorders

description: A newspaper in a Minnesota prison began publishing more than a century ago. The paper covers prison life and gives its writers purpose. It’s one of around two dozen similar publications nationwide.
title: This prison newspaper has been publishing for more than a century

description: The Labor Department reports Wednesday on what happened with inflation last month. Later, the Federal Reserve will provide an updated forecast of where interest rates are going.
title: A check on inflation and whether interest rates could be lowered

description: President Biden made a quick trip to Delaware after his son Hunter was convicted of felony gun charges. It's not clear whether Hunter Biden will appeal the conviction, or when sentencing will occur.
title: President Biden shows support for his son Hunter after being convicted in gun case

description: The U.S. men's team plays India in the T20 World Cup in suburban New York City. India advancing in the tournament is normal, but for the U.S. team it's unexpected. It has already beat Pakistan.
title: How to be a cricket fan when you're new to the sport

description: A change to the constitution of the Southern Baptist Convention could mark the end of women serving in pastoral roles.
title: Southern Baptist Convention set to vote on whether to ban female pastors

description: A tech company out of San Diego is working to solve the vexing problem that is child care, by creating a platform where employers, working parents and child care providers can connect and transact.
title: Can the tech industry solve child care problems? Some companies are betting on it

description: This year’s U.S. Senate race in Nevada is expected to be one of the country’s most competitive congressional contests this fall. It could decide which party controls the Senate.
title: Sam Brown wins Nevada's Republican Senate Primary to challenge Democrat Jacky Rosen

description: Hunter Biden is found guilty on all counts in gun case. House to vote on a resolution to hold Attorney General Garland in contempt of Congress. A check on the Fed’s campaign to curb inflation.
title: Morning news brief

description: Hardy was diagnosed with lymphatic cancer in 2004, and also had laryngeal cancer.
title: French singer Françoise Hardy has died at 80

description: About 60 of the 330 kids graduating from Newtown High School will also be carrying the emotional burden of knowing that many of their former classmates won't get to walk across the stage with them.
title: Sandy Hook survivors to graduate with mixed emotions without 20 of their classmates

description: Republican Sam Brown will face incumbent Democratic Sen. Jacky Rosen, who also won her primary Tuesday night, in a race that could help decide which party controls the U.S. Senate.
title: Sam Brown wins Nevada's GOP Senate Primary to challenge Democrat Jacky Rosen
